thread.section_title: The Union Democrat, Sonora, CA News, Sports, & Weather
thread.title: News of Record for Oct. 9, 2015

title: News of Record for Oct. 9, 2015
text: News of Record for Oct. 9, 2015 News of Record for Oct. 9, 2015 By Union Democrat staff October 09, 2015 01:00 am TUOLUMNE COUNTY The Sonora Police Department reported the following: WEDNESDAY 8:36 a.m., unwanted person — A man wearing a brown jacket was passed out on a bench in front of a South Washington Street business. 3:31 p.m., theft — A person was arrested for stealing two pairs of pliers and vice grips from a Sanguinetti Road store. 10:48 p.m., public intoxication — A drunk man was lying on the side of Hospital Road. 10:55 p.m., suspicious circumstances — Two people appeared to be vandalizing a Pesce Way car wash. The Sheriff’s Office reported the following: WEDNESDAY 10:53 a.m., Groveland — A man drove back and forth along Highway 120 and came up to a person’s residence while yelling. 10:57 a.m., Tuolumne — A Main Street trail was vandalized. 1:50 p.m., Jamestown — Two women inside a Highway 108 store were seen stuffing clothes into their bags and left after being confronted by employees. 2:06 p.m., Sonora area — A man appeared as if he was about to steal from a Mono Way department store. 2:30 p.m., Long Barn — An iPad was stolen from a desk inside a Fools Gold Street cabin. 4:07 p.m., Sonora — A woman called requesting civil advice about a man who she did not want to date. 5:19 p.m., Sonora area — An El Oso Way garage was burglarized. 6:05 p.m., Soulsbyville — A woman threatened another woman while a Soulsbyville Road elementary school student’s mother signed her student out of school. 11:05 p.m., Sonora area — A Colorado River Drive woman believed an unknown person was inside her home. Felony bookings WEDNESDAY 2:23 p.m., Sonora — Phillip Lee Smail Jr., 23, of the 22000 block of Loop St., Columbia, was booked on suspicion of possession of narcotic controlled substance for sale, felony committed while released on bail and misdemeanor possession of controlled substance paraphernalia after an arrest in a Mono Way shopping center. 5:15 p.m., Sonora — Jeffery Lynne Little, 61, transient, was booked on suspicion of two counts of violation of probation, vandalism of $50,000 or more, felony committed while released on bail and misdemeanor disorderly conduct of alcohol. CALAVERAS COUNTY The Sheriff’s Office reported the following: WEDNESDAY 3:46 a.m., Murphys — Unknown people shined lights near Coyote Drive. 6:31 a.m., Mountain Ranch — A man slept near a Washington Street bus stop. 12:41 p.m., Valley Springs — People stole rocks from the front of a Saint Andrews Road residence. 1:43 p.m., San Andreas — Unknown people were possibly looting in the area of Mountain Ranch Road. 2:45 p.m., Angels Camp — A man walked by a Tuolumne Avenue residence five times. 4:45 p.m., San Andreas — Someone entered an Old Stage Road woman’s residence while she had been evacuated. 11:02 p.m., Valley Springs — Young people wearing masks drove around Vista Del Lago Drive. 11:38 p.m., Valley Springs — Someone kicked the side of a person’s vehicle and left a dent on Highway 12. Felony bookings WEDNESDAY 9:50 a.m., Arnold — Justin Joseph Merlo, 26, of the 2000 block of Cedar St., was booked on suspicion of inflicting corporal injury and having custody of a child under 8 years old and assaulting the child producing in great bodily injury resulting in the child’s death after an arrest on Pine Drive. Arrests Cited on suspicion of driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs: WEDNESDAY 12:30 a.m., Angels Camp — Kenneth Everett Wilkerson, 25, of the 28000 block of Willow Springs Drive, Soulsbyville, was booked after an arrest on Highway 49.
